intro: Paradrymonia ciliosa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, pale pink to lavender flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, contributing to its soft, velvety texture. Paradrymonia ciliosa is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient choice for xeriscaping.
